website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for more than just a simple snapshot experience from a compact zoom camera, the Canon PowerShot SX700 HS should be on your short list, despite a couple shortcomings.
pros: Along with its 30x zoom lens, the Canon PowerShot SX700 HS has fun and useful shooting options
and excellent shooting performance and daylight photo and video quality
cons: Its low-light (high-ISO) photos could be better and while its battery life is noticeably better than that of its predecessor, you'll still want to keep an extra battery handy for all-day shooting
Canon could have done more with the camera's NFC

website_summaries.verdict: The Canon PowerShot SX700 HS has a 30x lens and a lot of features, but image quality suffers in low light.
cons: Detail suffers at very high ISOs
Limited control when using Creative Shot

customer_reviews.title: but glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: Can't add much, but glad I bought it. Life is a compromise and this camera is no exception. The instructions that came with it could be better and it is hard to handle w/o touching unintended buttons. So what's new? It's small and that's why I bought it. I'm very satisfied with the photo quality and with some technique it will work great. Really good price, but get an additional battery and a carry case; no brainer with any electronic camera. Wears out? Buy another one in a couple of years, they'll be better by then and it's not we're buying a Canon SLR to hand down to our children.
customer_reviews.author: 2kcender2

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera! Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera! Easy to use, fast response, good low light sensitivity, a really great zoom, good resolution and colors. Used it daily for two weeks tripping around Europe and did not run into any low battery problems as reported by others (charged nightly). The flash is a little cumbersome to deploy, but I haven't needed it much. Also wish you could do full resolution in auto mode (why is this not an option?). Note that I am an amateur, just taking photos for myself. I am not an artist. I have had a photography class and have been using various types of cameras off and on for 25 years and understand the technical details of cameras well.
customer_reviews.author: DarthMuffin

customer_reviews.title: No One Does Color Like Canon!
customer_reviews.text: BEST of the best! I've won awards for the pictures I've taken with this camera. I could own any camera I want, within reason, and this is the one I like the most. I have cameras that cost much, much more and they don't take as good a picture as this one does. Nobody does color like Canon. I am delighted with this camera. I have been taking pictures regularly over the past 50 years and this is one of the best cameras I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.author: RN

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for travel
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for a trip to Europe and I was not disappointed. It is very compact and easy to use. The photo quality is outstanding. Keeping steady while using a long zoom can be problematic; try to brace the camera on something. I was slightly disappointed that you can only use a wrist strap and not a full, around the neck strap since there is only one small place to insert the wrist strap. Always use the strap as the camera can be a bit "slippery," so to speak. Overall, I am very happy with the camera. I recommend it for compact design and photo quality.
customer_reviews.author: Brad M.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Camera, Performance, and Functionality
customer_reviews.text: This little camera is awesome. It has almost the same functionality as my Nikon D7000 without, of course, the wide range of lenses. However, this weekend I tried the "sports scene" and the photos were as good as my SLR. Focusing and processing are extremely fast with the new DIGIC 6 processor. The 30x telephoto delivers amazing results. The camera is slightly more bulky then my Canon SD 960S, but still fits comfortably in my pocket. I would call myself a fairly experienced photographer and would highly recommend this camera for casual use, travel, family photos and just a camera to have with you for spontaneous events.
customer_reviews.author: Geppetto

customer_reviews.title: Great zoom, easy to use, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Great camera with lots of easy to use features. I especially like the sport setting. The zoom is the best! If it's in a low light place it's harder to get good focus & any movement causes blurring if you use the zoom. Takes magnificent close ups of nature with good outdoor lighting when using the zoom!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: but there are enough manual functions you can control it to do it's best, and if you use image software to process ...
customer_reviews.text: It has a smallish sensor in it but it is helped out significantly by the DIGIC 6 processing software. I have several Canon cameras with the same sensor, but DIGIC 4 and they are not as sharp, especially when zoomed. This also has 30X in a camera you can fit in your pocket. It's not a professional camera, but there are enough manual functions you can control it to do it's best, and if you use image software to process after the fact, the images, even though only JPG, are very manageable to enhance with software. Bought it for the 30X lens, and it does what I want.
customer_reviews.author: JM SmithTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: This is a great point and shoot that offers excellent features for the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great point and shoot that offers excellent features for the cost and provides excellent value for the money. We have been using the camera to capture family photes for more than a year, and are very happy with both the quality of the photos and the rugged construction of the camera. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: DBarr

customer_reviews.title: Not an ourdoor camera
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed at outdoor pictures. I took it during a vacation in the Rockies. Big mistake. Lot of photos were out of focus when zoom was used (optical not the digital) and very under exposed with out much color. For a point and shoot camera, Auto should have taken care of this. I have owned many Canon cameras and this is the first time I am having exposure issues. I have taken many indoor pictures and color, exposure were good.
customer_reviews.author: ZL

customer_reviews.title: The 30 x zoom is awesome and the features options are wonderful - best of ...
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a small but powerful camera that wasn't to big or too heavy as I have arthritis in my hands, I am blown away with the picture quality and the ease of use. The 30 x zoom is awesome and the features options are wonderful - best of all - it still fits in my jean pocket! For anyone who is just an amateur photographer that want to take brilliant photo's you can't go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: Feltre

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera for somebody who wants nice pictures/video but without ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera for somebody who wants nice pictures/video but without all of the work associated with a camera that has changeable lenses. We have to get used to the flash being off by default but the pictures and HD video are definitely consistent with what you should expect from a camera in this price range...or even a tad higher. Coupled with our Canon Pixma 922 printer this unit has some very cool and convenient features as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lopez (Avid Buyer, Reader & Judge of Goods & Services)

customer_reviews.title: Received a BLACK camera when I ordered the RED---WIFI problems
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the RED and received the BLACK camera in a box that was marked for "RED"----so it was originally packed incorrectly. I have been unable to make WIFI work from the camera to my Toshiba Laptop computer but I have only been at it for an afternoon. Hoping that it is simply a setting on my computer that is not recognizing the camera on my wireless network. I like the feel of the camera and the functionality. I really want the WIFI to work as that was a major factor in choosing this camera. I also wanted the RED color. Opening the box was a disappointment. Hoping the camera is not!
customer_reviews.author: Green Acres Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera.
customer_reviews.text: Had this since 2015; still learning all it can do. So far, so good. I took an online "test" offered by Cannon, which suggested this as a camera I would like. And I do ... small enough to fit in my purse, settings-enough for different conditions, stills, video, and mixes. I love this camera!
customer_reviews.author: H. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera. Good autofocus and manual
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera. Good autofocus and manual. A lot more control than the last Powershot I owned. Two frustrating things: the camera strap wasn't adjustable and that's essential (otherwise it will just fall off your wrist when holding it) and it's really easy to accidentally hit the Mobile upload button, which then turns off the camera. That kind of drives me nuts. But other than that, it's a wonderful camera. The 30x optical zoom is incredible and the main reason I got this particular camera.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: SEEMS LIKE A GOOD CHOICE FOR TRAVEL.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera to take on a vacation trip overseas to replace my bulky Nikon D3200 SLR. The Canon PowerShot SX700 is compact, lightweight, and takes remarkable pictures. It can be worn on my belt and overall takes up much less space that the Nikon. Getting the Canon iMAGE GATEWAY set up is a little tricky, but once established provides a cloud storage for pictures accessible from multiple medias. Although I have not put the Canon to much of a test thus far, this September when we visit Greece will be the real determination.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: This is great
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality camera. It is a little bulkier than most of the compact cameras but the added features make this very compelling. It has a very fast processor, long optical zoom. Very good contrast. If you want a bridge between a digital 35mm and the little point and choot or cell phone cameras this Canon SX700 should be considered. Canon puts in software to make a virtual wi-fi connection with your cell phone so you can move pictures for sharing on social networks.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: A fine light camera
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a Canon EOS 7. Great when I am working out of my home, but increasingly, with my three lenses on trips that are not fantastic (e.g. Antarctica), a burden I have been satisfied with my Canon, but I wanted something light and good. And the 700 is. It does very well with totally automatic as well with aperture and time control. The zoom is wonderful. It takes great pictures. It is light. Fast to set up. Very good with its focus. I will buy a mirror-less soon, but for the time being this is a great camera
customer_reviews.author: S. Kohn

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX700 HS Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: I had a little trouble adapting to it, moving from a much larger (physically) older Canon PowerShot. After having taken several thousand pictures with this camera I do love it. I take primarily outdoor scenery and wildlife pictures so this is perfect. I was also able to get what I consider great pictures of the full moon eclipse in September 2015 with this camera and no tripod. I have not used the Wi-Fi capability yet.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Hard to take a good picture 😔
customer_reviews.text: Pictures outside are okay but it is hard to take a clear picture. Disappointed because my last canon was much better. The shutter window cover gets stuck and the pictures far away are really not clear. Even if t A person is 6 feet away it's not really that clear.
customer_reviews.author: traveler37

customer_reviews.title: great camera. i chose this camera specifically because of ...
customer_reviews.text: great camera. i chose this camera specifically because of the zoom capability. i recently having returned from a vacation i was able to see the photos taken with the camera. they are very clear and i was able to get close ups of targets that i would not have been able to with other cameras. for a dslr substitute in both price and productivity its a great camera for the price, size and weight.
customer_reviews.author: bookah

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted and needed
customer_reviews.text: I consulted Consumer Reports to find a camera to fit my needs and was able to buy this via a link in CR to Amazon. I wanted the camera specifically to take close-up pictures of my knitting and jewelry to post on Pinterest. This camera does a great job. The Canon software that transfers the images to my laptop is really easy to use -- takes just a minute or two from start to finish. I LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: Joan Whitney

customer_reviews.title: the usefulness of the camera will so easily pay for its cost many times over
customer_reviews.text: The SX700HS is to-date, the highest-end (ultra- zoom and DIGIC processor) compact camera that is supported by the CHDK program. For enthusiasts, it is both a low-cost and high-quality tool for capturing natural phenomena such as solar eclipses, lightning, auroras, etc. With CHDK capabilities, the usefulness of the camera will so easily pay for its cost many times over, I'm sure you want to be buried with it. I think it's no longer in production, so buy the remaining new or used ones, and get ready for the next solar eclipse.
customer_reviews.author: keeps

customer_reviews.title: I have always been very pleased with the Canon cameras I've purchased
customer_reviews.text: I have always been very pleased with the Canon cameras I've purchased, but was disappointed with this one. I've only used the Auto setting so far, but have found that my outdoor shots are often overexposed. I've also had problems using the zoom for closeups on the Auto setting - the auto focal point does not seem to center on the subject in the foreground automatically. I haven't tried the Manual settings yet, but bought this as I wanted a small point-and-shoot, so would prefer not to have to use Manual settings all the time. I haven't taken a lot of pictures with this camera yet, so hopefully will have more success as time goes on
customer_reviews.author: Karen Treadway

customer_reviews.title: Took it on safari, and got terrific closeups.
customer_reviews.text: The additional digital zoom, which I normally wouldn't use, allowed me to see things I otherwise couldn't. Put it on Auto, and shot everything. Great movies, zooming in and out during the movie. But still so convenient that it would fit in my shirt pocket easily. The stabilization worked great at far out zooms. Loved everything about it.
customer_reviews.author: MLSreality

customer_reviews.title: Good little camera
customer_reviews.text: Good little camera. It's what I expected. I did some online research first, reading the reviews. Before this I had the Canon SX260 and SX280. They are great cameras, so I figured this one would be. Because of the longer telephoto factor, it often needs a monopod for the extreme telephoto shots at 30x. Not a problem, since I have one. As a semi professional photographer, I like to have a small camera in reserve, especially for travel. The longer focal length is nice to have. My main camera is a Canon DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: James D Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Compact, good quality but don't like the flash
customer_reviews.text: I love the size, the color, the quality, the feel and also how good the pictures are...the only thing that gets me is the flash. You have to pretty much manually engage flash by pressing down on a selector on the side of the camera every single time to make flash come up, unless I am doing something wrong, that is very annoying, this is the reason I won't give it a 5 star rating, but it is for now my every day camera
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Good Product But, I have Issues
customer_reviews.text: The camera takes good pictures as expected, but when the flash is used, it drains the battery too quickly. I took 30 photos using the flash at night and it depleted the battery by 80%. Also, I have trouble getting the wireless connection to work with G-Data Security Suite firewall. Neither Canon or G-Data has been any help. Canon suggested I use the cable and not use the wireless feature! What!! I bought it mainly due to the wireless connection capability.
customer_reviews.author: EngineerinMe

customer_reviews.title: They keep getting better!
customer_reviews.text: I've been shooting with Canon SX cameras for about 10 years. They tend to last me about 2 to 3 years and are a great value for my mode of shooting. Small and light enough to carry with me just about everywhere, and cheap enough that I don't feel the need to be overprotective of it. I miss the AA battery convenience, but the Li-ion battery for this one is great and it's easy to keep extras charged and ready when I'm out on the road.
customer_reviews.author: jerryous

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera! The pictures it takes are beautiful, and its small enough to take with you anywhere. No changing lenses or putting together a huge camera bag, its just ready to go when you are. I cannot express how easy it is to use and how gorgeous the pictures are. They are just as clear and professional looking as any big camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought it six months ago and after using it only like four month
customer_reviews.text: This camera might be a lemon. I bought it six months ago and after using it only like four month, I had minor problems with turning it "On". I would fiddle around with it a bit, then it worked again for a while. But a few days ago it totally quit on me. I don't know if it is worth fixing it or trashing it. When this camera works it takes great photos. I am a street photographer and very seldom leave the house without a camera. But if it doesn't work, there is not much I can do about it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Troyer

customer_reviews.title: Highly impressed
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing. I use it for sports. I can record in HD my kid on the other side of the 400M track sprinting as if I was right there. Very very nice camera with tons of functions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing

customer_reviews.title: CANON SX700 great travel or vacation companion
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. About the only thing it lacks is a built in panorama function. Very compact. Carried it around in pockets of dungarees, slacks, and shorts all day every day of two week vacation. Always ready for quick shot opportunities. Lens stabilization very effective even at very high zoom levels. Wifi connection seems a little iffy at times but that could be a learning curve problem on my part. Very, very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: MiniPilot

customer_reviews.title: Generally excellent "point-n-shoot" camera
customer_reviews.text: Generally excellent "point-n-shoot" camera, with sharp and vivid pictures. The color is very "true to life". Two downsides noted so far: 1) When the battery gets low, it drops dead with very little warning. Fortunately, I bought a couple of reasonably-priced Vivitar replacement batteries. 2) The second issue is the lack of an optical viewfinder. In bright ambient light, the glare off the back screen can make it impossible to see what you're aiming the camera at. I just took a lot of pictures while pointed in the right general direction, and several were adequately framed, but I'd rather see what I'm aiming at.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Bogardus

customer_reviews.title: ... after a year of use it just doesn't take good pictures, they are almost always out of focus ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera for my parents and after a year of use it just doesn't take good pictures, they are almost always out of focus and blurry, I have taken better pictures on my phone than this camera produced. It recently broke, the lens jammed and I sent it in for repairs and received a new camera in the mail, so the canon customer service is pretty awesome. I would not recommend this camera to a friend
customer_reviews.author: Bb

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing! I just took it on my recent trip and the pictures turned out wonderful! It was so worth the money! It takes pictures that looks like they came from a 700 dollar camera at least. There are multiple settings for different locations and lighting. It also has a really long battery life. I recommend this to anyone looking to get almost a professional grade camera without the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Renee

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this camera for our trip to Africa. The pictures that we took, close ups and at a great distance, were clear, great color. Our safari guide was quite impressed with its capabilities. Sure he's seen a few cameras in his day. We were so happy with our camera that we gave our first one away and immediately replaced it with the same camera. If you are looking for a lightweight, easy point and shot, this is the camera for you. Found the 30x zoom lens is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Excellent picture quality. Zoom works really well, better than expected. Stabilization program very effective. Menu is not all that intuitive. Battery life = about a day's worth of off and on use while on a recent vacation. But bought 2 extra batteries so never had a problem. Charging is quite quick in the supplied charger (not in the camera). Start-up time and time between shots is excellent with the only real delay of about 2-3 seconds if the flash is used. Easily fits in pants pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Paradocs

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have used lots of so-called Point and Shoot cameras in my long life, but this one is the best, so far. Typical Canon quality, great, and the auto mode will outdo 99% of the users abilities. Sharp lens, fast shutter, fast focus, and what's not to like in this pocket camera.
customer_reviews.author: GGG

customer_reviews.title: Lots of camera for the price. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: I am still getting used to the features of this Canon. This will replace my other point and shoot cameras. It is solidly built and has a little weight to it. I purchased it after reading the CR reviews and comparing it to similar cameras. Cost plus features made it a good value for me. Using a door jamb to steady my hand, I was able to max zoom in on the full moon and take a pretty cool photo that included details of the craters.
customer_reviews.author: CS Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: I like this camera a lot. However the pictures taken outside in bright light are much better than indoor pictures. The main reason I gave it a four instead a five is because I would like it much better if the flash would work automatically when set on Auto. I'm not good at remembering to pop up the flash. I'm still getting used to it but I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I have had a canon powershot before and loved it before it gave out on me. I got this one after a lot of research and was a little disappointed. The flash is not automatic, the battery does not last very long and the focus takes much longer than my previous camera. Maybe I will get used to it. Hopefully!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine K.

customer_reviews.title: Was what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Image quality is great and the ease of use makes this a good camera that anyone can use. The video and the straight photo quality is great and switching back and forth is easy. The zooming is nice and pictures are better than that on phones. It allows you to use different modes seamlessly and it is easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: W. Hammen

customer_reviews.title: Great camera that has the versatility to do stills and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera that has the versatility to do stills and video. Great picture quality. Great benefit is you can transfer you photos and video via wi-fi without the need to constantly switch storage disk. Would definitely recommend purchasing an extra battery with charger unit.
customer_reviews.author: Nitro7131

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting!
customer_reviews.text: Returned it! It is a nice camera but i was not satisfied at all with the video quality in low light... Very dark and grainy. Amazing though when outside and bright sunlight available. Takes nice pictures but when you use the flash it would take forever to be ready for the next picture so i lost few special moments, enough to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: EVO09

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Canon
customer_reviews.text: Pretty basic camera, but for what it is, ( I bought mine as a light weight travel camera) it serves well. Fill flash for those sunny day portraits works surprisingly well. ALWAYS prefer Canon cameras. This time I went 1st with a Nikon....... only to return it and buy the Canon!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Milner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pictures. It is advertised as 60 x zoom
customer_reviews.text: Superb camera,first used it on a one month tour of Europe. Excellent pictures. It is advertised as 60 x zoom, but has 120x zoom, amazing. Used it to photo recent lunar eclipse, couldn't use the entire zoom as the moon overfilled the screen at more than 90x zoom. Would buy it again without question
customer_reviews.author: wewdesert

customer_reviews.title: Compact, good battery life, solid structure, great WiFi capabilities with my iPhone
customer_reviews.text: Incredible! Used this camera while backpacking Europe along with visiting many other locations in the USA. Compact, good battery life, solid structure, great WiFi capabilities with my iPhone. Get this camera, well worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: I like this camera a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like this camera a lot. I bought it for a trip to Ireland because I didn't want to carry the big one and risk losing it. This camera takes great photos but the one thing that really bothered me was that there is no viewfinder. It definitely would get a 5-star review from me if it had that one thing.
customer_reviews.author: REH

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded to this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to upgrade my other canon from long ago. Love the 30x zoom and clarity of the pictures. It's extremely easy to record video with the video button right next to the zoom. I'm still getting use to it. I love the feature of being able to share it wirelessly to a compatible printer and smartphone. For the phone, all I had to do was download the app and all the pictures I had on the camera showed up on the phone. The only con I have is the size and weight. It's a bit heavier and bigger than I'm used to but I think it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Rodie

customer_reviews.title: Nice pics but not for big hands guys :-)
customer_reviews.text: Camera takes great pictures. However, it's kind of small so my big hands have a tendency to push buttons accidentally. I find myself turning it off by mistake quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: brobanks

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera...
customer_reviews.text: This camera is just awesome. I can't say anything bad or have any complaints about it's functionality, design, and image quality. The zoom function is very good and the image does not get fuzzy when taking photos. Always go with Canon... you can't go wrong...
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: works and it is easy to make it work
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good camera; and it is very easy to operate. And, that is saying a lot coming from an old guy.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Rybarczyk

customer_reviews.title: This is truly a PHOTO CANON.
customer_reviews.text: Luv this camera....I needed a compact size with a GREAT ZOOM, & this one met all my expectations. Great images, Great video, Pretty Good battery life & fantastic ZOOM. Lens fully retracts for easy pocket carry, very compact. Advise arm rest or tri pod at full zoom. Great Optic stabilizer & & pretty quick focus. Images comparable to my T3.
customer_reviews.author: jaynic

customer_reviews.title: for concert photos this camera takes the cake and even at distance
customer_reviews.text: I waited to write my review until I took it with me to my most frequent camera situations at a concert. There it's a lot out factors to think of like low lighting and distance from the stage. I've had a power shot previously but it's 6 years old now, the sx700 blew my old one away. Using the 30x zoom I was able to get clear and tight photos from 100' or so away. It was also able to adjust to the lighting at that distance as well. I look forward to more concerts after this first one, it's well earned it's five stars for me.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing zoom, poor battery and flash
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The zoom is incredible. The only thing I don't like is the flash. It doesn't comes out automatically. When you need to use it, there's a button you have to press and then when you don't need it, you have to push back the flash. The battery doesn't last too much when using recording HD Video, I bought an extra battery. Everything else is just great.
customer_reviews.author: Adolfo

customer_reviews.title: the quality of the pictures seems to better and clearer
customer_reviews.text: I got this as an upgrade to a previous Canon point & shoot camera and so far with the few pictures I've taken, the quality of the pictures seems to better and clearer. This has proven to work great in low light situations. I am continuing to experiment with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good battery life (I never use the wifi feature)
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good battery life (I never use the wifi feature), takes excellent shots in auto mode and easy to program. Slow motion video leaves something to be desired, but it gets the job done for what I bought it for. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M Bania

customer_reviews.title: The new recommended app does not work either so don't but if ...
customer_reviews.text: The new app to connect this camera to my i-phoone no longer works. The new recommended app does not work either so don't purchase it if your main reasoning is the wifi. Flash is akward and there is no usb. Without the usb and no app to send pictures you are back to taking the card out and loading your pics to phone/cloud/computer.
customer_reviews.author: Nettie Tenny

customer_reviews.title: Great camera---no Canon help
customer_reviews.text: I did not receive an owners guide that explained the complexity of this camera and it's operation. My call to Canon was cordial and positive that they would send a users guide to my home....none arrived. Great camera---no Canon help.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis of Derby

customer_reviews.title: Best camera of this type on the market!
customer_reviews.text: Best point and shoot camera I've ever had. You'll be amazed at the quality of the photographs you get with this camera. I use it in the field for bird and other wildlife shots and really love it. It is so small it goes everywhere. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Waters

customer_reviews.title: A Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: A great pocket camera with excellent wide angle and telephoto range. Excellent video quality too.
customer_reviews.author: Love the New Tech

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: A great camera. Tons of features, more than I need. Wifi takes a little time to get used to. Lists of trial and error.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot SX700 HS Digital Camera - Wi-Fi Enabled (Black)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackThe Canon Power Shot SX700 HS digital camera features a powerful 30x optical zoom that lets you get right down onto the field to preserve a big play, reach deep into the forest for spectacular wildlife close-ups, and capture majestic architecture just the way you see it. What's more, the camera's advanced technology ensures truly impressive quality in every shot, even at the long end of the zoom. The Canon HS System - a 16.1 megapixel high-sensitivity CMOS sensor and DIGIC 6 image processor - provides excellent detail and color in low light. Smart AUTO makes high-quality imaging easy in any situation, and Intelligent IS keeps shots clear and steady. Best of all, built-in Wi-Fi lets you transfer images and video directly to select social networking sites, mobile devices and your computer, so you can share from almost anywhere. Plus simply touch the camera to a compatible Android device using built-in NFC (Near Field Communication) for easy wireless connectivity.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

EXPERIENCE ULTRA ZOOMING POWER
Whether you're capturing family activities, seeing the sights on vacation, or pursuing your favorite hobbies, you'll want the amazing zooming power of PowerShot SX700 HS at your side. With the camera's powerful 30x Optical Zoom, you can get right down onto the field to preserve a big play, reach deep into the forest for spectacular wildlife close-ups, and capture majestic architecture just the way you see it. What's more, the camera's advanced technology ensures truly impressive quality in every shot, even at the long end of the zoom. The Canon HS SYSTEM – a 16.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor and DIGIC 6 Image Processor – provides excellent detail and color in low light. Smart AUTO makes high-quality imaging easy in any situation, and Intelligent IS keeps shots clear and steady. Best of all, built-in Wi-Fi® lets you transfer images and video* directly to select social networking sites, mobile devices** and your computer, so you can share from almost anywhere. And simply touch the camera to a compatible Android™ device*** using built-in NFC (Near Field Communication) for easy wireless connectivity.

* Compatible with iOS versions 6.0/6.1/7.0, Android smartphone versions 2.3.3/4.0/4.1/4.2/4.3 and Android tablet versions 4.0/4.1/4.2/4.3. Data charges may apply.
** With the download of the free Canon CameraWindow app. This software enables you to upload images to social network services. Before uploading images, please be aware that image files may contain privacy related information such as people and places. If necessary, please delete such information. Canon does not obtain, collect or use such images or any information included in such images through this software.
*** Compatible with Android devices version 4.0 or later.

POWERFUL ZOOM, SPECTACULAR IMAGE QUALITY
30X OPTICAL ZOOM
No matter the situation, you can be confident that the PowerShot SX700 HS camera's genuine Canon 30x Optical Zoom (35mm equivalent: 25–750mm) will capture images with exceptional brilliance and clarity. Canon's innovative Intelligent IS system analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation – allowing you to focus on framing and capturing your shot. And Zoom Framing Assist delivers automatic tracking, so you can easily reframe long-zoom shots without losing your subject. Even the camera's easy-to-grip shape is specifically designed for a secure hold and steady shooting.

ZOOM FRAMING ASSIST
The PowerShot SX700 HS camera has the telephoto reach to capture subjects a long distance away using its powerful 30x Optical Zoom. At maximum telephoto, however, it can be challenging to track a moving subject. The Zoom Framing Assist seek function makes it much easier to use the camera's powerful zoom lens. When you press and hold the Zoom Framing Assist function button, the camera will automatically zoom out to include a wider angle of view, enabling you to more easily locate your moving subject. Once you find it, releasing the button will cause the lens to return to its original zoom position, intelligently keeping the subject in focus until you're ready to shoot and capture the perfect close-up moment. You can even make zoom adjustments while the button is pressed, with an animated assist frame that makes viewing easy. When the button is released, the lens will return to the adjusted zoom position.

You can also use Zoom Framing Assist to keep your subject's face the same size in your frame no matter how they move. Tap the Zoom Framing Assist function button to detect your subject's face. As your subject retreats and advances the camera automatically zooms in and out so their face remains the same size. It's especially useful for capturing the expressions of fast-moving children. And, for even more convenience, the Zoom Framing Assist function is also available when shooting video.

SHARE IMAGES AND VIDEO WHEREVER AND WHENEVER
BUILT-IN WI-FI® MAKES SHARING QUICK AND EASY
The PowerShot SX700 HS camera is equipped with built-in Wi-Fi® technology for on-the-go convenience when you want to share your photos and videos with friends, family and the whole world. Easily post your images to social networking and media sites – Facebook®, Twitter®, YouTube™, Flickr® and now Google Drive™ – through CANON iMAGE GATEWAY# directly from your PowerShot camera, or save them to the online photo album to share anytime, anywhere. The camera can also connect directly to both iOS® and Android™ devices*, and upload images via the free Canon CameraWindow app** without a computer. You can control the destination of your uploads to share with everyone or to selected groups, and even add comments. Sharing video is also easy with the PowerShot SX700 HS, which records video using the easy-to-share MP4 format. Enhanced Wi-Fi® makes posting in real time possible, so you can keep everyone up to date with photos and video even as events unfold. The built-in Wi-Fi® technology on the PowerShot SX700 HS also allows you to transfer images to other Wi-Fi® equipped PowerShot cameras or print your photos directly to a PictBridge (Wireless LAN) certified printer.

One-touch connection to your mobile device or computer is made possible on the PowerShot SX700 HS with the camera's dedicated Mobile Device Connect Button. You can choose to transfer images to your smartphone or tablet for immediate sharing with the CameraWindow app**, or to your computer on the same network with Image Sync to make saving and organizing your images easier. When the camera finds a linked computer on the same wireless network, images are sent directly to it. Otherwise, images are temporarily stored on CANON iMAGE GATEWAY then transferred once a connection is made, eliminating the need for cables.

REMOTE SHOOTING
With the built-in Wi-Fi® on the PowerShot SX700 HS, you can use your smartphone or tablet* to remotely control the camera. Simply connect wirelessly to your device and access the free Canon CameraWindow app**. Your device will show a live image of the camera's capture – perfect for a commemorative group photo, wildlife shots and all kinds of situations. The camera's versatile 30x Optical Zoom, flash, self-timer and shutter are all under your control, with images being saved to your camera as usual.

* Compatible with iOS versions 6.0/6.1/7.0, Android smartphone versions 2.3.3/4.0/4.1/4.2/4.3 and Android tablet versions 4.0/4.1/4.2/4.3. Data charges may apply.
** This software enables you to upload images to social network services. Before uploading images, please be aware that image files may contain privacy related information such as people and places. If necessary, please delete such information. Canon does not obtain, collect or use such images or any information included in such images through this software.
# One-time registration is required on CANON iMAGE GATEWAY online photo album.

SIMPLY TAP TO CONNECT
BUILT-IN NFC (NEAR FIELD COMMUNICATION) FOR EASIER WI-FI® CONNECTIVITY
The PowerShot SX700 HS camera supports NFC (Near Field Communication) technology, eliminating the need to find and open the Canon CameraWindow app* on your mobile device. Simply touch the NFC icon on your camera to your compatible Android device**, and the CameraWindow app will launch automatically for quick, easy sharing of your images. Built-in NFC technology also makes it simpler to install the app. If the app hasn't been installed yet, once you touch the devices together for the first time, the download screen will display automatically.

* This software enables you to upload images to social network services. Before uploading images, please be aware that image files may contain privacy related information such as people and places. If necessary, please delete such information. Canon does not obtain, collect or use such images or any information included in such images through this software.
** Compatible with Android devices version 4.0 or later.

PHENOMENAL IMAGES AND INCREDIBLE PERFORMANCE START HERE
16.1 MEGAPIXEL HIGH-SENSITIVITY CMOS SENSOR
The PowerShot SX700 HS camera features a 16.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor to make even your everyday photography remarkable. The large sensor takes in more light, so images are clear and beautifully detailed. High ISO shots are particularly impressive, with less noise and expanded dynamic range. And the 16.1 Megapixel resolution gives you the flexibility to be more creative with your shots: crop and enlarge any part of an image – you can be confident that the detail and resolution you need are there.

DIGIC 6 IMAGE PROCESSOR
The PowerShot SX700 HS camera is equipped with the DIGIC 6 Image Processor, which makes several important advancements to image quality both in stills and video. Improved light sensitivity allows for higher resolution with less noise when shooting in dark conditions, and Dynamic IS now detects and compensates for tilt and parallel movement (shift blur) to create video that's exceptionally free of distortion. The processor also enhances the performance capabilities of the PowerShot SX700 HS, enabling high-speed, high quality continuous still image shooting at up to 8.5 frames per second. And video recording is better than ever, as the DIGIC 6 Image Processor enables Full HD at 60p, as well as MP4 recording. Highly compressed MP4 video not only preserves space on your memory card but also improves playback on mobile devices. Plus, with MF Peaking possible thanks to the DIGIC 6 Image Processor, you'll have a pro-level focusing tool at your disposal.

CANON HS SYSTEM
The PowerShot SX700 HS gives you the power to capture beautifully detailed, naturally lit images even in low light – reducing the need for flash and the occasionally unwelcome effects it produces. That's because the camera's 16.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor works with the camera's latest generation DIGIC 6 Image Processor to create the Canon HS SYSTEM, specifically engineered for spectacular low-light performance. With the Canon HS SYSTEM, you'll experience excellent tracking performance even in low light, and achieve gorgeous still image quality at ISO speeds up to ISO 3200; beautiful low-light shots are possible with minimal noise and maximum detail in highlight and shadow areas.

STUNNING FULL HD VIDEO THAT'S BETTER THAN EVER
CAPTURE STUNNING 1080P/60P FULL HD VIDEO WITH A DEDICATED MOVIE BUTTON
The PowerShot SX700 HS not only preserves your special video memories with spectacular realism and detail, but also does it in a format that makes them easy to share. You can simply press the dedicated movie button to start and stop video recording, so you're always ready to capture the moment as it happens. The camera records in stunningly realistic 1080p Full HD so even when played back on a big-screen HDTV, your videos are crystal clear, with smooth action and beautifully natural color. You can choose to record in 30 fps or 60 fps, so even fast-moving subjects are captured with crisp detail. And videos are recorded in MP4 format, perfectly sized for quick online sharing – whether you're showing relatives what the kids are up to or posting status updates on social networking sites.

RETHINK PHOTOGRAPHY WITH CREATIVE SHOT
CREATIVE SHOT MODE
In addition to its super-powerful 30x Optical Zoom, the PowerShot SX700 HS also turns out impressive artistic photos with Creative Shot mode. Rather than randomly applying filters, Creative Shot mode takes advantage of advanced Canon technologies to analyze the individual scene, subject and exposure to apply any of 46 filter options. In addition to the original shot, the camera automatically produces and saves five additional variations of the composition. Filter choices are grouped into Retro, Monochrome, Special and Natural categories to make exploring the world of artistic photography fun and easy, or simply select Auto to access the full range of effects. With Creative Shot mode, the result is stunning artistic photos that are perfect for sharing.

SHARE WITH A SINGLE TOUCH
MOBILE DEVICE CONNECT BUTTON
It's now easier than ever to connect your PowerShot SX700 HS camera to an iOS® or Android™ device* using the Mobile Device Connect Button. The button allows you to choose to transfer images to your smartphone or tablet for immediate sharing with the CameraWindow app**, or to your computer on the same network with Image Sync to make saving and organizing your images easier. Once your device is registered on the camera, simply press the Mobile Device Connect button for easy connection.

By connecting to a smartphone with the CameraWindow app using the Mobile Device Connect Button, you can browse and share images while still leaving the camera inside a bag. It is also possible to turn off the PowerShot SX700 HS quickly and easily, directly from a smartphone. Once your camera is linked to your computer on the same wireless network, you can automatically transfer images to it, for easy saving and organizing of your photos. The Mobile Device Connect Button is great for quick and easy sharing from a fun day out with friends and family.

* Compatible with iOS versions 6.0/6.1/7.0, Android smartphone versions 2.3.3/4.0/4.1/4.2/4.3 and Android tablet versions 4.0/4.1/4.2/4.3. Data charges may apply.
** This software enables you to upload images to social network services. Before uploading images, please be aware that image files may contain privacy related information such as people and places. If necessary, please delete such information. Canon does not obtain, collect or use such images or any information included in such images through this software.

REMEMBER THE DAY IN CRISP HD
HYBRID AUTO
Capture the essence of special days – vacations, important occasions or any time you're shooting many shots in a day – using Hybrid Auto on the PowerShot SX700 HS. Hybrid Auto records up to four seconds of video every time you shoot a still image, then automatically joins the day's clips and pictures* into a video. The feature also makes sure the "highlight reel" is stunningly beautiful by automatically recognizing the scene and optimizing camera settings to capture the highest possible image quality. The resulting 720p HD video is properly exposed, crisp and steady.

* Pictures can be withheld from the resulting video via menu settings.

A SMARTER CAMERA MEANS BETTER PHOTOS AND VIDEOS
SMART AUTO
Smart AUTO on the PowerShot SX700 HS makes capturing sharp, bright colorful images and video as simple as pressing the shutter button. By assessing various factors in both the background and the subject, the system recognizes 58 predefined shooting situations and automatically selects the camera settings that will yield the best possible results. Simply frame the shot you want, and in dozens of common or challenging scenarios the camera takes care of the rest. Hard-to-capture shots such as moving subjects, night scenes, backlit subjects, and landscapes at evening or on a bright snowy day are instantly and effortlessly captured as "keeper" shots. Smart AUTO makes the PowerShot SX700 HS ideal for capturing excellent quality still images and video on the go.

SHOOTING MODES
Manual You have complete control of exposure, selecting both aperture and shutter speed manually. Aperture-priority You set the aperture, controlling depth-of-field. The camera automatically selects the shutter speed. Shutter-priority You select the shutter speed, and the camera automatically selects the appropriate aperture. Smart AUTO The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity. Movie Digest & Hybrid Auto Automatically selects shooting settings for optimal quality and records a video clip every time you capture a still image. One day's worth of clips are then combined into a single video. Program The camera automatically and intelligently selects the aperture/shutter speed combination based on the shooting conditions. Live View Control Enables Brightness, Color, and Tone adjustments to your images using easy-to-understand controls. Creative Shot Analyzes the scene and applies a number of creative filters to automatically create five variations in addition to the original image. Sports The camera uses high shutter speeds to capture fast-moving subjects. Portrait Brings the subject into focus while beautifully blurring the background. Smart Shutter The camera automatically takes the photo when people smile, wink, or get into frame. High-Speed Burst HQ Captures fast-action shots at full resolution, providing continuous shooting when the shutter button is held down. Handheld Night Scene Take clear and steady pictures at night without the use of a tripod. Low Light For high quality image capture in an amazing range of dimly lit situations. Snow Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint. Fireworks Create brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks. Fisheye Effect Now you can get the fisheye effect – a classic photographic distortion – without a fisheye lens. Miniature Effect Give images a miniature look with an effect that emphasizes perspective by blurring the top and bottom of the image. Toy Camera Effect Simulates photos taken with "toy" or pinhole cameras, darkening the image at the edges to create a vignette effect. Monochrome Choose from three single-tone effects: Black-and-White, Sepia, or Blue. Soft Focus Creates a hazy ambiance that's perfect for portraits and wedding photos. Super Vivid Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors. Poster Effect Poster Effect combines several similar shades into one color, turning subtle gradations into eye-catching, scene-popping contrasts. Movie Record video; unwanted scenes can be deleted in playback mode. iFrame Movie The Apple® movie format, iFrame, makes it easier and quicker to import and upload videos while retaining high image quality. Super Slow Motion Movie Record your clips in high speed (approx. 240 fps), and then watch your videos in slow motion. Actual results may vary from examples shown above.
Final image may vary depending on picture composition.

ADDITIONAL FEATURES
INTELLIGENT IS
It's easy to capture clear, steady images with the PowerShot SX700 HS, even in low light without using a tripod. That's because the camera is equipped with Canon's innovative Intelligent IS. The system automatically analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation – allowing you to focus on framing and capturing your shot. For stills, the system selects from Normal IS, Panning IS, Macro (Hybrid) IS and Tripod modes. When shooting video, the system selects from Dynamic IS, Powered IS, Macro (Hybrid) IS and active Tripod IS modes. New icons clearly mark the image stabilization mode, whether you're shooting still images or video.

Still Image Shooting Normal IS Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills. Panning IS Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement. Macro (Hybrid) IS Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting. Tripod When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed. Video Recording Dynamic IS Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking. Powered IS Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified. Macro (Hybrid) IS Corrects for motion blur that is likely to occur when shooting video while walking. Also compensates for the shift-type camera shake common in macro shooting. Active Tripod IS When shooting video while using a tripod, the image stabilization is active to compensate for slight camera shake. ECO MODE
The PowerShot SX700 HS features ECO Mode, which provides more shots per single charge through LCD monitor and camera power management. ECO Mode can be activated for easy power preservation when you're out shooting for the day or the moment is too exciting to put the camera down. The mode quickly wakes the camera from sleep when a button is pressed. With ECO Mode activated to conserve power, you can even stay connected for longer with the built-in Wi-Fi® featured on the camera. When the fun with family and friends runs late into the night, you can be assured your camera can keep up.
